column5: if anyone is interested Radioworld has Terrova 101/US2 36V 60 "  With I-Pilot Link  on for $1700.00  that is 350.00 cheaper then the smaller  Terrova 80/US2 24V 60 " With I-Pilot Link           $2,050.00  and $800.00 off it's regular price they have 2 in stock   http://radioworld.ca/trolling-motors-c-3_539.html?filter_id=177
wa wh wh what is a frogs butt air tight     we will be right on top of those trout and whitefish
Well thats cool.  I bought a new auger today. We are even. LOL
Wow, if I had room for 3 batteries up front I'd be all over this.
Hey Terry  You are gonna love the 'Spot lock'    It is the best for jigging up Lakers and Whitefish!!  No need for the riggers and 150' of anchor rope/chain
Hey hey hey. Lets not go off the deep end here.LOL

Hey Terry  You are gonna love the 'Spot lock'    It is the best for jigging up Lakers and Whitefish!!  No need for the riggers and 150' of anchor rope/chain yup will be using it for that  and it works great as  an auto pilot for downrigging too
TERROVA 101 with ilink yup time to retire the 80lb fortrex
TERROVA 101 with ilink yup time to retire the 80lb fortrex  It will do fine on your toon.
yeah the extra battery might be too much for the toon or you know it might just happen  lol
Let me know how you like the terrova Terry. I've been debating the fortrex or terrova for a while now.

I will most likely not get to use it till the spring  I have used both in the past and do prefer the  fortrex  when fishing docks or a tight area where you need quick exact control  cable is way better but you can't get ipilot/ilink with a cable steering electric like fortrex so I will be happy because of the extra  features on the terrova
I have the 24V i pilot/link. The BEST $$ ever spent..especially since I fish alone most of the time. I couldn't run downriggers  without it...

Terrova for me.  It's better for all around fishing.  But if you're focused more on just shallow water fishing and in tight covers,  I'd get a cable steer like fortex. However I do a bit of everything so the Terrova fits the bill nicely.  I had an absorbent amount of money or it was my career,  I'd have both the fortex AND the Terrova
